text: Transcription of a minimal promoter from the <extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene is regulated by CREB / ATF and <extra_id_0> SP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins in U937 promonocytic cells .

<extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is an important transcriptional regulator of genes induced in activated monocytes / macrophages , and <extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is the only CCAAT / enhancer - binding protein ( C / EBP ) family member whose steady-state mRNA levels increase upon activation of monocytes ( 1 ) .

We show that increased transcription of the <extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene is responsible , at least in part , for induction of <extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA following activation of U937 promonocytic cells .
